comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I wonder what happened to R.V. Matthews?  I searched the AWM site - no mention of him as wounded or killed.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Hi Beachcomber - the WW1 nominal roll records him as returning to Australia on the 27 of August 1917. bit.ly/SJkBHG I you are super keen you can look at his full service record through www.naa.gov.au. You probably already know but just go to 'Search the Collection' then 'begin your search'. Surname & service number usually work best. Looks as though he was invalided home after spending most of his service in hospital....
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thanks for the links,  I did not know.  It is amazing how much more interesting an old photo like this one becomes even with just one name in many faces.  And slightly spooky;  I feel like I might be disturbing their RIP.
